reviewText:
For the record my favorite Worms game of all time is Worms Armageddon. The art style, the game play, weapons, level editor, and game layout (options, theme, layout of menus) were all done right. This is when games were made to be bought once, and to be bought as a whole.

I saw Worms Ultimate Mayhem as a recommended game instead of Armageddon. The first thing that caught my eye was that this game was the 3D version of what I loved so much. I figured for the on sale price, I'll give it a shot. I can tell you that I am not at all disappointed with my purchase (except that Worms is still a turn based game! I wish they would make a real time one - how? Well I'm not getting paid to make or suggest games). Seeing worms in 3D is phenomenal, and the art and them style they chose to go along with the game just fits it perfectly. The game play is just as good as ever, however will take some time to adjust and get used to the new range/power system. I didn't know a worm could throw a grenade three football fields away from the map. Lesson learned.

Game play itself can be seen from first person or third person worm view. Weapons are varied as usual and are cool to use and shoot. The explosive or corrosive materials found around the map can also be used to eliminate your opponent. Does the 3D land disappear after you blow it up? Damn right it does. How are the camera angles? Actually quite consistent when using weapons, can be a bit confusing or frustrating when simply observing the map. I find that even with unchecking the inverse box for camera angles sometimes it turns itself back on. This is usually fixed by simply squaring the screen with the worm again. That's essentially the only complaint I have is the camera controls.

This game does have CONTROLLER SUPPORT - which is greatly appreciated.

This deserves an 8.1/10 as worms in 3D with the game play and art style they chose, I'd have to give it a .1 over than my solid 8 average. It is a fun game - and can keep you busy for a while with the story, challenges, or just a quick match.

For future Mayhem games (or 3D worm games), maybe try getting rid of the turn based system, or play around with allowing more first person type of play. Do something XCOM : enemy unknown would do (wait, take cover and fire at the enemy when in range) with worms the player isn't using. Also, please try to improve the camera controls!

reviewText:
I was 3D Worms fan as a kid. Is this game is a childhood ruined or exchanced? I'm on the fence.

This game is more or less an expanded version of old Worms 4: Mayhem. Most notable changes are graphical upgrades and Worms 3D singleplayer campain available to beat. Those are fine additions and the core gameplay is still okay, but there are noticable problems.

Overall art still is a cartoony but normal-looking 3D graphics clash with poor cel-shaded explosion effects - this combination just don't work. Old Worms 3D effects where more eye inviting. Music is completely horrible. Worms 3D (game) and Armagedonn had a distinctive styles: happy-party and grim-doomy respectively. This game is just bland with uninspiring music and no art direction.

Game is slower paced than a 2D worms, which is not a bad thing on it's own. However, overall experience isn't what fun, thanks to the sluggish weapon and utilities physics. Weapons behave very strangely. Some are extremely reliable (constant 50DMG Bazooka shots) or suprisingly unreliable (Banana Bomb). On top of that, AI is still stupid as a Sheep. Team 17 never programmed a fine artificial enemies.

Worms 4 singleplayer missions are uninspired. they are paired with pretty bland story around them. The included Worms 3D missions are more interesting. They are compact, focused and not bounded in half-baked story arcs.

Menus ergonomy and UI needs a complete rework. Hidden important options, difficult navigation, poor visuals.

This game is somethat a fun experience, but you need other people with the same preference to the 3D Worms games as you. With friends, you will have a blast, thanks to the better controls and hilarity of events. You don't have such people around you? Make a pass. You had enough of Worms in 3D (no matter, if in the good or bad way)? Make a pass. I'm still giving this game a Upvote, but it is a close one. I feel really generous today or maybe I feel nostalgic to those original Worms 3D missions?

If the 3D branch of the Worms series didn't irk you, then you will find this really is the ultimate edition. It has the Worms 3D campaign as well as a new one, and tons of other new features. Of course, most fans feel like the move to 3D made the game too unreliable to play and I tend to agree, but I'm still enjoying it. It's just a very different game. You'll find arching lobbed grenades way harder, but direct line of sight attacks are much easier to hit. And it also gives you an indicator for when melee attacks will make contact, so you won't goof them up.

Good game here. I'll keep returning to it, but it wont replace the 2D Worms experience. It's a supplement.

Why is there even a reason to NOT buy this game?
Worms: Ultimate Mayhem is a mashup of one of my favorite games of all time - Worms 4 Mayhem and the original Worms 3D. If you're one of those hardcore Armageddon players who didn't really enjoy stepping into full three dimensions, this is absolutely not the game for you. As for me, since I've started my Worms saga in World Party and rapidly progressed to W4M, I think this is a welcome blast from the past.
Although simple and somewhat basic, weapon creation is definitely enjoyable. Add the ability to customize your military annelids  and you've got the recipe for a good first impression. Combat takes a while to get used to, with the default setting being toggled to inverse Y axis (useful for controllers, not so much for the mouse - modify that in your settings). The W4M story has the humour I remember, putting you in the place of a team of students in a quest through time.

Overall, I believe it is quite worth the price it achieves when in sales (3,24‚Ç¨ - about five dollars) and is enjoyable alone and with friends, be it online or on the same machine. Have fun!

reviewText:
Worms has always held a very strong position in my opinion. It wears it's heart on it's sleeve: It isn't an A-List game and it isn't for everyone. But for me, it's one of the most passionately developed game series ever.

Things have certainly moved on since the side-scrolling invertibrate slaughter-fest of the first games to the 3D variants of the game. And whilst I did love the 2D games, I have to admit that I prefer the 3D versions. Ultimate mayhem combines the best bits of two great titles: Worms 3D and Worms 3: Mayhem, keeping all the best bits from both and removing the bad.

The customisation is absolutely fantastic: Worms with Pope hats and 3D glasses shooting bazookas at Worms with Bunny ears and disco glasses has to be one of the most hilarious things in gaming.

As I said before, it's turn-based nature and sometimes fairly difficult missions are not for everyone. But if the thought of carnage, explosions, flying sheep bombs, alien abductions, an endless array of hats and voices, air-strikes and a huge concrete donkey even makes you smile, then perhaps you should give this game a look.

You won't regret it.

reviewText: Unlike most of the previous 2D Worms games, Worms Ultimate Mayhem features a 3D, turn-based artillery strategy that allows player to move freely rather from left and right. In the game lobby, players are able to choose from a wide variety of different weapons and use them when the game starts. At the start of the game each player is able to control four worms, due to the game turned-base nature, each player control one worm at a time with a set time limit; when the time limit expires or when the worm fires a weapon, the player's turn will end and the opponent will start his turn. The objective of the game is to eliminate all of the enemy team worms. There are two ways that a worm can be eliminated. The simplest way is to deplete the worm of its health, that can be done by choosing a weapon, aiming it at the enemy worm, and firing at the opposing team worm. The second way is to knock the worm out of the platform; some weapons provide the ability to push or knock back the opposing worm. Once a worm is eliminated, it cannot be brought back to life and once all four of a player's worms are eliminated the game will end. The team with worms left standing is the winner.

Oh yes. This game is... THE MOST LEGENDARY GAME FROM MY CHILDHOOD! I remember playing worms 4 mayhem when I was like 8 years old. And this game is basically the same, just better.

The gameplay: Turn based, 3D gameplay. While it's most fun when played with a controller, it'll be almost as fun with your keyboard and mouse. It's also so much fun with local multiplayer, since A) There's usually no one at the online multiplayer and B) You can't smash online opponents with the controller. Also the story mode is a ton of fun. You get the full story mode of worms 4 mayhem and worms 3d! Also, you'll be fine with a single controller, since you just give the controller to the person who has the turn.

The music: OHMYGOSHYES!!!!! The soundtrack is just amazing. I want to describe it with the word: Masterpiece. I downloaded almost the full soundtrack because the music is just so awesome. It's very calm, but fits the game for some reason.

Also, you can create your own teams (with hats and stuff), weapons and gamemodes. I absolutely and warmly recommend this game. Now go ahead and buy it.

Anyone who's ever played a worms game would know the basic concept. You play as a worm, your job? To kill the opposing worms. Obviously, the main  components in this game is multiplayer, but there's a few other modes for people who can't use multiplayer.... for particular reasons.

Let's get right into the multiplayer! The multiplayer works just like every other worms game in the series, turn based. One player goes first, attacks... or not, depends, and then after they have either attacked or ran out of time, the next player goes. Before you start a match though, there's a slot machine, that can be used to randomly select 3 twists to add to your game, your you can choose them yourself! These twists are really interesting, and make every game different from the last. Some of them are; not being able to use anything but ranged weapons, you can only move using the grappling hook,or only being able to use weapons from crates! The online mode is basically the same thing, but no slot machine, and so is single player battles, except you play against a computer.

The campaign is by far my favourite part of the game. At the start of each level, you are given an objective, e.g. destroy the building, kill the enemies, climb the tower, all that kind of stuff you would expect. The variety of different levels really keep things fresh, from a dinosaur attack, to the old western, nothing ever seems dull. At the end of each level though, you get coins, which can be used to buy things for your worms in the shop.

The shop is where you can buy more things to customize your worms. You see, before you start the actual game, you should make yourself a team. You can name your team members, dress them up, and even choose a speech bank to make them sound like English Bobby,  or even a robot! Not only can you buy things to customize your worm with in the store, but you can also buy new premade levels based on the single player missions to use in multiplayer, or even new game modes! There is also a whole load of items you can only unlock if you own other games on your steam account though.

In the end, worms ultimate mayhem is tons of fun with friends, also a whole load of fun in single player,  and with the immense variety of levels and customization options, you will not get bored soon.

My final rating is... 8.5/10
